The intention is for us to create a cgroup for the pod prior to pulling any
images for any container used in that pod and starting them.

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/26751#discussion_r68434206

Since we are exploring the ability to have a remote runtime for the Kubelet
here:

https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/17048

This change would allow the OCI runtime to explore the ability to charge
image pulling to the pod using tools like skopeo, and if/when we add blkio
support, we can account for the image pulling appropriately to the pod
rather than the node without needing to change the Kubelet remote API.

Runtimes that want to innovate in this space are then free to pursue it
from the start without requiring any version changes etc.

comments.body: Do we want to explicitly remove the container? We don't do that today.
I don't think we need the sandbox container, so it should be ok to delete. Adding more operations to the sandbox may not be desirable.

Hmm....This might be a problem because when all containers in the pod are terminated, we'd be left with a PodSandbox. 
- For hyper, we want to stop the sandbox vm, but not delete all the containers in it because we need to use them as tombstones (due to the lack of checkpointing in kubelet).
- For docker, we want to stop the sandbox container, and it doesn't matter whether we delete the sandbox or not because that won't affect other containers.

How about we add a `Stop()` method to stop the sandbox (which will also stop all the containers in it, if there is any), but will not delete them. On the other hand, `Delete()` will also delete all the containers associated with the sandbox?
